channel.title: Teagle Podcast
channel.itunes:author: The Teagle Foundation
channel.description: The Teagle Podcast is a production of the Teagle Foundation, a philanthropic organization based in New York City that provides leadership for liberal education, marshalling the intellectual and financial resources necessary to ensure that today's students have access to challenging, wide ranging, and enriching college educations. Episodes range from interviews by Teagle president Bob Connor with grantees as well as with other influential people in American higher edcuation, recordings of talks, and audio essays.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Teagle Podcast features interviews by Teagle president Bob Connor with grantees as well as with other influential people in American higher edcuation, recordings of talks, and audio essays.
channel.itunes:summary: The Teagle Podcast is a production of the Teagle Foundation, a philanthropic organization based in New York City that provides leadership for liberal education, marshalling the intellectual and financial resources necessary to ensure that today's students have access to challenging, wide ranging, and enriching college educations. Episodes range from interviews by Teagle president Bob Connor with grantees as well as with other influential people in American higher edcuation, recordings of talks, and audio essays.

item.title: Derek Bok and Nicholas Kristof on Undergraduate Education
item.itunes:author: The Teagle Foundation
item.description: Derek Bok, President emeritus of Harvard University and author of "Our Underachieving Colleges A Candid Look at How Much Students Learn and Why They Should be Learning More," and New York Times Columnist Nicholas Kristof share their thoughts on student learning and undergraduate college education. Delivered at the Teagle Foundation's New York Seminar on Liberal Education, February 13, 2006.
item.itunes:subtitle: Derek Bok, President emeritus of Harvard University and author of "Our Underachieving Colleges A Candid Look at How Much Students Learn and Why They Should be Learning More," and New York Times Columnist Nicholas Kristof share their thoughts on student learning and undergraduate college education. item.title: Eliminating Racial and Ethnic Disparities in College Completion and Achieve
item.itunes:author: The Teagle Foundation
item.description: W. Robert Connor, President of the Teagle Foundation, interviews David Harris, Vice Provost for Social Sciences and Professor of Sociology at Cornell University on Eliminating Racial and Ethnic Disparities in College Completion and Achievement. David is the principal investigator on a Teagle Fresh Thinking working group on the subject.
item.itunes:subtitle: W. Robert Connor, President of the Teagle Foundation, interviews David Harris, Vice Provost for Social Sciences and Professor of Sociology at Cornell University on Eliminating Racial and Ethnic Disparities in College Completion and Achievement.
